intro: Nasturtiastrum graminifolium, commonly known as the grass-leaved nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It features slender, grass-like leaves and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant is part of the Tropaeolaceae family, which includes other popular garden nasturtiums. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often used in ornamental gardening for its colorful blooms. The plant is also valued for its edible flowers and leaves, which have a peppery flavor.
